  • Introduction

Manifolds:

  • Real vector space: \(\mathbb{R}^n\)
  • Symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Sym}(n)\)
  • Skew-symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\)
  • Sphere: \(\mathbb{S}^n\)
  • Special Orthogonal Group: \(\operatorname{SO}(n)\)
  • Stiefel Manifold: \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\)
  • Grassmannian Manifold: \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\)
  • Variety of Low Rank Matrices: \(\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r)\)

  • Grassmannian Manifold: \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\)

Grassmannian Manifold: \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\)¶

\(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\) is the Grassmannian manifold, that is, the subspaces of dimension k in mathbb{R}^n. A subspace is represented by an orthonormal basis, that is, by an element in operatorname{St}(n,k).

class geotorch.grassmannian.Grassmannian(size, triv='expm')[source]¶

Grassmannian manifold as a projection from the orthogonal matrices \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\). The metric considered is the canonical.

Note

This class is equivalent to GrassmannianTall, but it is faster for the case when \(n\) is of a similar size of k. For example, \(n \leq 4k\).

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • triv (str or callable) – Optional. A map that maps \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\) onto the orthogonal matrices surjectively. It can be one of [“expm”, “cayley”] or a custom callable. Default: “expm”

uniform_init_()[source]¶

Samples an orthogonal matrix uniformly at random according to the Haar measure on \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\).

class geotorch.grassmannian.GrassmannianTall(size, triv='expm')[source]¶

Grassmannian manifold parametrized from is tangent space using the orthogonal projection from the ambient space \(\mathbb{R}^{n \times k}\). The metric considered is the canonical.

Note

This class is equivalent to Grassmannian, but it is faster for the case when \(n\) is of a much larger than k. For example, \(n > 4k\).

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • triv (str or callable) – Optional. A map that maps \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\) onto the orthogonal matrices surjectively. It can be one of [“expm”, “cayley”] or a custom callable. Default: “expm”

uniform_init_()[source]¶

Samples an orthogonal matrix uniformly at random according to the Haar measure on \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\).
